sen.j: 日置 光平（へき みつひら）は、江戸時代の武蔵国の刀工。
sen.e: Mitsuhira HEKI was a sword craftsman in Musashi Province, who lived during the Edo period.
Mitsuhira HEKI was a sword craftsman in Musashi Province who lived during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: "who"の前のカンマは、特に必要ないので、削除しました。
sen.e: Mitsuhira HEKI was a sword craftsman in Musashi Province who lived during the Edo period.
He was a representative craftsman of Edo Sekido school.
sen.cmt: 江戸石堂派→Edo Sekido schoolとしました。
sen.e: He was a representative craftsman of Edo-Ishido-ryu school.
He was a representative craftsman of Edo-Ishido-ryu school.

sen.j: 新刀上作にして良業物。
sen.e: The swords he made were shinto (New swords; a new type of swords made in Keicho era (1596) or later) and josaku (excellent in quality), and he was classified as one of the yoiwazamono (good craftsmen in the lists of Wazamono [selected sword craftsmen]).
sen.cmt: 良業物→yoiwazamono (good craftsmen in the lists of Wazamono [selected sword craftsmen])としました。新刀→shinto (New swords; a new type of swords made in Keicho era (1596) or later)としました。上作→josaku (excellent in quality)としました。
sen.e: His swords belonging to shinto (New swords; a new type of swords made in Keicho era (1596) or later) were well-made, and ranked as ryowazamono (ranked No. 3 in the list of Wazamono (swords determined based on the result of trying out a new blade)).
sen.cmt: 新刀上作にして→His swords belonging to shinto (New swords; a new type of swords made in Keicho era (1596) or later) were well-made（新刀は、刀の種類なので、"belong to"としました。）良業物→ryowazamono (ranked No. 3 in the list of Wazamono (swords determined based on the result of trying out a new blade)（業物とは、試し切りの結果に基づいて決められたもの（http://www.shouzando.com/tameshigiri3.htm）を指し、この場合、光平の刀について述べているので、変更しました。）
sen.e: His swords belonging to shinto (New swords; a new type of swords made in Keicho era (1596) or later) were well-made, and ranked as ryowazamono (ranked No. 3 in the list of Wazamono (swords determined based on the result of trying out a new blade)).

sen.j: 京を経て江戸に移住し、出羽守を受領して銘に菊紋を切ったものがある。
sen.e: After living in Kyoto he settled down in Edo (present Tokyo), and he was appointed Dewa no kami (the governor of Dewa Province), and some of the swords he made have an inscription engraved with a kikumon (crest of chrysanthemum).
sen.cmt: 京→Kyotoとしました。江戸→Edo (present Tokyo)としました。
sen.e: When moving to Edo (present-day Tokyo) after living in Kyoto, he was appointed Governor of Dewa Province, and made swords some of which had kikumon (crest of chrysanthemum) engraved as an inscription.

When moving to Edo (present-day Tokyo) after living in Kyoto, he was appointed Governor of Dewa Province, and made swords some of which had kikumon (crest of chrysanthemum) engraved as an inscription.

sen.j: 弟とされる者に対馬守常光や越前守宗弘がいる。
sen.e: Tsushima no kami (the governor of Tsushima Province) Tsunemitsu and Echizen no kami (the governor of Echizen Province) Munehiro were attributed to be his younger brothers.
Tsunemitsu, Governor of Tsushima Province and Munehiro, Governor of Echizen Province, were considered to be his younger brothers.
sen.cmt: 対馬守→Governor of Tsushima Province越前守→Governor of Echizen Province
sen.e: Tsunemitsu, Governor of Tsushima Province and Munehiro, Governor of Echizen Province, were considered to be his younger brothers.

sen.j: 作柄としては備前一文字風の作をよくこなす。
sen.e: He well dominated the style of Bizen Ichimonji group.
sen.cmt: 備前一文字風→the style of Bizen Ichimonji groupとしました。
sen.e: He often made swords in a pattern following Bizen Ichimonji group.
sen.cmt: 「備前一文字風の作柄の刀をよく作成した」との意味に解釈しました。
